revised_title: Nerve Distribution and Ganglia in the Liver and Biliary System
tldr: The author, Robert Lee, conducted dissections to study the distribution and arrangement of nerves in the liver and biliary system. He discovered that nerves accompany the hepatic artery and its branches, forming ganglia and plexuses. These nerves also surround the hepatic and cystic ducts and the gallbladder. Lee found that these nerves originate from the semilunar ganglion and solar plexus, providing a better understanding of the liver's nerve supply and its connections to the digestive system.
